<@U02BYQ8CHT7>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Using our v2 product-service hook`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Priority:* `High priority ðŸ”´`
*Description:* `Hey team, I went to cleanup our v1 -> v2 product-service rollout but it seems you began using this hook yday here: <https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/58741>
This was a temporary hook (this is outlined in the README) so we could transition to v2 product-service. I'm currently working on the cleanup ticket to remove this v1 vs v2 functionality and this will be using v2 once my PR is merged (<https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/58976>). If this is not intended and you require v1, please respond here so i can hold off on merging and remove the use of this hook! Thanks!`
*Expected behaviour:* `Not using temporary hook`
*Actual behaviour:* `Using temporary hook`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-issue

_thread_replies.text:
hey <@U7SJ525DE> - :fyi_brat: the `useLatestProductInfo` hook you used is a migration hook that VMS owns and will be deprecated. It is controlled by a feature gate that weâ€™re about to rollout and deprecate, which will switch over the hook from v1 products-service endpoints to v2.

You should use `useProductInfo` or `useV2ProductInfo` directly, not this hook

PR in question: <https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/58741>
<!subteam^S030M7977CY> please address this so we can safely rollout our changes and deprecate the feature gate

attachments.text:
## Description

Ticket: <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/TPT-2168|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/TPT-2168>

We are phasing out relying on the delivery option handle to find the subscription cadence, so we would like to use the subscription endless pause interval instead.

## Relevant Technical Notes :computer:

Key changes:

â€¢ Creates a hook to get the delivery cadence from the subscription. Later we will get this data from CDPS but for now we can use `endlessPauseInterval` from the subscription object.
â€¢ Changes the `useSubscribedPlanData` hook to remove Redux usages.

## Monitoring :mag:

<https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/board/aCYTmyxhqju/KN-TPT-health|https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/board/aCYTmyxhqju/KN-TPT-health>

## Testing :test_tube:

1. Log in with an active account
2. In the dashboard, the cadence displayed in the quick action card is correct. If you change it, it updates accordingly.
3. The other quick actions cards are displayed correctly.
4. The meals title with the plan name (on top of selected recipes) has the correct information.

## AI Generated Code :robot_face:

What GenAI tool was implemented in this PR, either fully or partially?

â€¢ Copilot
â€¢ Cursor
â€¢ Other (please specify)
â€¢ None

## Rollbacks :leftwards_arrow_with_hook:

â€¢ Easy :sunglasses:
â€¢ Moderate - Outline challenges in reverting these changes.
â€¢ Hard :sob: - Explain complexities in rolling back these changes.
attachments.title: #58741 [TPT-2168] Update cadence source

<@UFC7CRXMZ>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Delivery Address Change & Delivery Option Issue`
*Topic:* `Delivery Date and Cadence`
*Priority:* `Low priority ðŸŸ¢`
*Description:* `I changed my delivery address on my account from 10005 zip to 14092 zip. When I made the change, it showed that the Friday delivery day was possible with a frozen delivery. However, this is not actually the case and it should not have been possible. `
*Expected behaviour:* `The delivery day to automatically change to an option that's possible `
*Actual behaviour:* `The delivery day stays on Friday which isn't an available delivery day choice`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-issue

<@U03UMPD2NNS> at glance this looks to me like an issue that would be occurring before I migrated the API. And we did test such edge cases, and QA passed for those. However we did not explicitly test this specific calendar picker. I will need to dig into this to see if I can reproduce and see where the problem is, if that's indeed a regression introduced yesterday or this component needed its own fix to begin with. I will check that asap, and of course we will address it

cc <@U8F7ZDAPM>

_thread_replies.text:
Thanks Mateusz. I think you'd need to do the following to reproduce:
â€¢ Choose a Fresh or Mixed plan
â€¢ Have a delivery option selected that is available for a certain zip but not another zip e.g. Friday delivery in zip 10005
â€¢ Change the zip to a zip where Friday is not available e.g. 14091 or 14093 might work (I used 14092 but Jordan has made Friday delivery available in that zip as a one off as I need to get some orders delivered on a Friday so don't use 14092 as a test)

elements.text: Thanks Mateusz. I think you'd need to do the following to reproduce:
Choose a Fresh or Mixed plan
Have a delivery option selected that is available for a certain zip but not another zip e.g. Friday delivery in zip 10005

Change the zip to a zip where Friday is not available e.g. 14091 or 14093 might work (I used 14092 but Jordan has made Friday delivery available in that zip as a one off as I need to get some orders delivered on a Friday so don't use 14092 as a test)

_thread_replies.text:
I closed another task, and now had a chance to look into this. I wasn't able to reproduce

What I did:
1. on mix plan, set zip code that has Tuesday available, switched to Tuesday delivery option
2. switched zip code to where Tuesday is not available, it moved me to Wednesday (Wednesday and Friday were the only available ones on the new zip code)
3. went to dashboard, went to reschedule -> calendar
4. in the calendar I'm already on Wednesday, and only Wednesday and Friday are available, which is exactly what this new zip code offers
 I will get back to it tomorrow and prioritize the investigation for tomorrow

<@UFC7CRXMZ> I checked on live, used the zip codes you provided, I'm still having trouble reproducing your experience. I skipped the part where I'm checking the backend responses, but everything is in line with what is configured in Logistics Configurator

I'm not sure about the exact timeline of when Jordan was updating availability and you updating the zip code, but delivery options take time to update (~10min or so) after you set up the new configuration in LC. So something might have been updated on the fly when you were testing - it's just a hypothesis, but not unlikely scenario

*Question title:* `Pets Table SKU explanation`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `Hi team, I am reaching out to get some clarity on some of the product SKUs from KN and FJ that comes as shown in the screenshot. We use the SKU to derive box size, and some of them have bigger numbers like 550, 1000 etc. Can someone help clarify what do they mean and how it is different from the others which are below 12(Check thread for screenshot).
We use Product Family API to derive this.`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question

_thread_replies.text:
hey <@U02S6UR6XGB>! SKUs in TPT are based on the number of calories the pet needs. you can read a bit about it here: <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TNV/pages/3869180383/The+Pets+Table+-+SKU+Menu+and+Recipe+Mapping#Subscription-SKU>
for FJ SKUs (I assume you're talking about Factor Form), you can reach out to <#C06AT2BC72R|>

elements.text: hey
! SKUs in TPT are based on the number of calories the pet needs. you can read a bit about it here:
for FJ SKUs (I assume you're talking about Factor Form), you can reach out to

_thread_replies.text: Thanks for the clarification. Is there any way to derive box_size? Generally box_size for us is person size. So if a box is meant for 2 people, it will be 2.

elements.text: Thanks for the clarification. Is there any way to derive box_size? Generally box_size for us is person size. So if a box is meant for 2 people, it will be 2.

_thread_replies.text: the concept of box size in TPT is not the same as for meal kits, cause the number of food packs they receive in their box is based on the amount of calories their pet needs and the recipes selected

elements.text: the concept of box size in TPT is not the same as for meal kits, cause the number of food packs they receive in their box is based on the amount of calories their pet needs and the recipes selected

_thread_replies.text: Understood, thanks for the explanation

_thread_replies.text:
Hi <@U7SJ525DE>,  sorry for bringing this thread back. I was checking the product API payload and I do see the size is assigned as calories. Is that done by design or can this be fixed?

```{"id":"64402d0867c8d74d200d1c64","active":true,"country":"KN","legacy_handles":[],"meal_swap":true,"meal_swap_default_choice":"1","swappable_meals":"","is_preset_enabled":true,"is_subscribable":true,"is_available_for_extra_meals":false,"name":"Air-Dried Plan - 8 weeks of food","handle":"KN-DR-1-175-0","legacy_ids":[],"price":9968,"one_off_price":9968,"recurring_price":0,"special_fee":1099,"public":true,"specs":{"meals":1,"size":175,"recurrency":0},"sort":1001,"family":"dry","scm":"Dry - 175 calories","scm_short":"","scm_size":"","created_at":null,"updated_at":"2024-07-19T10:10:50.000-05:00"}```

_thread_replies.text:
> Is there a way to have a separate field for that since the definition of size then mixes up for other brands
Could you help me understand what this means exactly, in what ways is this causing issues?

To provide more context from our side, these SKUs are heavily tied to how our application and features are built so it's extremely unlikely that we can change that on the short term. That being said we do already have some challenges with our current architecture and we're planning on starting an investigation into redefining our product architecture so we could try to take this into account when we do that, but again this is not something we expect to finish any time soon

elements.text: Is there a way to have a separate field for that since the definition of size then mixes up for other brands

That being said we do already have some challenges with our current architecture and we're planning on starting an investigation into redefining our product architecture so we could try to take this into account when we do that, but again this is not something we expect to finish any time soon

_thread_replies.text: Thanks for the details. We use the size attribute as box size in our analytics table. It is a dimension table in DWH and used by all analytics stakeholders.
